column4: Heya. I changed to Ati Radeon driver (instead of fglrx), but I changed back. I rebooted, but there was a new kernel (*.20 instead of .19) and now the only ting that works is 640x480 =(
when I set the res to 1024 it's all "scrabbily"
What do I do?
Please :(
check what driver its currently using
should I run a command?
open  up konsole and type "grep Driver /etc/X11/xorg.conf"
Driver "kbd" /n  Driver "mouse" /n  Driver "synaptics"
its a laptop?
it looks like yoru driver line isnt even there anymore
I guess I've screwed it even more up :p
run `sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
and follow the prompts. select "ati" not fglxrx unless you know the ati driver is installed
All done. Now I do a reboot?
just `sudo /etc/init.d/kdm restart` should do
then kdm
Thanks! Are you Norwegian?
no, i'm not

thanks anyway ;) Quick question: I see there's some options for multiple monitors in the control panel, but they're greyed out... Is there an easy way to use two monitors in linux? I think it looks a bit hard editing the xconf file...
there is, but its easyest with an Nvidia card(what i have), so i dont know about ati
i would check teh forums if i was you
